intro: Brassica pe-tsai, commonly known as Chinese kale, is a leafy green vegetable belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, dark green, cabbage-like leaves that are tightly clustered at the base. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small yellow flowers in the spring. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Brassica pe-tsai is rich in nutrients such as vitamins A, C, and K, as well as dietary fiber.
